comments.author: Liu Stark

comments.text:
That adaptor is a power killer. And on that manifold will often lose 
driveability too.IF the Q jet is in good order it should be better than the 
Holley on that manifold.  The Holley may be better on a Performer or 
similar.
The standard HEI too is a good piece, if it is worn out repair it. MSD and 
others do excellent replacement coils and modules for them.  GM did do a 
LOT of development on those pieces.﻿

comments.author: spik3stactical

comments.text:
+spik3stactical I have only ever heard of some of the plastic Griptilians 
forming blade play. Personally I like the feel of the Spyderco Cage-ball 
lock to the Axis. 

That is interesting. The only thing close to rock lock I have on any of my 
better knives is with my Spyderco Tuff. With gloves on and a taped blade, 
pressing dangerously hard I an get the Ti lock bar to slip a bit since it 
has a steel lock face, but no failure.

Also, it is hard to believe, but the Cold Steel Tri-add lock has a few 
hints of up and down when it breaks in, but never a concern of failure. It 
is just because the lock is self adjusting.
comments.author: Random Guy

comments.text:
Honestly, just stick with a spiderco, I'm consistently sending mine back 
every 3 months for up and down play. Mini grip, 300-1, and auto triage, all 
have up and down play.

and 940... just never did it. 

I have plenty of Spydercos, Cold Steels, Kershaws, Bokers... ect... just 
have not pulled the trigger on a Benchmade yet.

comments.author: CarMad97ci

comments.text:
The Chevy has a cam priority oiling system. High rpm's on a Chevy kills the 
rods bearings since they get oil last. The Ford 302 and 351W have a main 
priority oiling system where the mains then rods get oil first then the cam 
and the rockers last. Down fall of that is the front rockers can get 
starved of oil but with a little plumbing it can be fixed. Rather have worn 
rockers then spun rod bearings. It's common in circle track when running a 
stock Chevy the top end gets flooded with oil then the bottom end get's 
starved for oil.Fix for a high rpm stock Chevy block is oil restrictors but 
you have to run a mechanical cam.﻿
